item.title: Planter Full of Nettles and weeds, 24th June
item.description:
There is a planter full of stinging nettles on the right as you enter the estate. In general the planters across the estate are not being maintained, watered or weeded any many are full of brambles, stinging nettles and weeds.

item.title: Fly tipping by bins, 24th June
item.description:
Someone is fly tipping next to The Heights bins located in the car park every week. The bins on the Heights are supposed to go in the new store opposite but keys have not been provided to waste management or the home owners. The bins smell, are overflowing and are encouraging fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Heights, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No curb access, 24th June
item.description:
On the following streets in Bexleyheath there were no curb access on one or both sides of the road for my mobility scooter. Mark Close and Kipling Road. I had to go halfway down Kipling to cross the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berkeley Avenue, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish fly tipping., 24th June
item.description:
It’s coming from 129 Croydon Road BR3 3RA as they are re-fitting the old restaurant into a tanning salon and are just dumping the rubbish out the back. It’s been going on for weeks. The entrance to where I live looks like bloody Bagdad and this needs to be sorted asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunbar Avenue, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pigeon Infestation 101 Belgrade, 24th June
item.description:
I’m a resident living in a flat adjacent to the rear of 101 Belgrave Road, and there is currently a serious pigeon infestation at the back of the building. The pigeons are roosting and nesting in areas of the hotel property and their droppings are spreading onto my flat’s external walls, windows, balcony, and inside the apartment at times. This situation is presenting three major issues: 1. Health hazard – pigeon droppings can carry diseases and are a sanitation risk. 2. Safety hazard – the droppings make surfaces dangerously slippery. 3. Property damage – acidic droppings are staining walls, corroding surfaces, and creating a constant cleaning burden. I have already spoken to the staff at the hotel (girls working upstairs), but no action has been taken. The hotel is the source of the infestation and must address pigeon-proofing. Under Westminster City Council’s responsibilities, pest control — including installing deterrents such as netting, spikes, or bird wire — is provided free of charge for private and commercial properties. I request that Environmental Health or Pest Control services inspect the hotel’s rear property and serve a notice requiring the installation of pigeon-proofing measures. Desired outcome: • A prompt inspection of 101 Belgrave Road by council pest control or environmental health. • Implementation of pigeon deterrent measures (e.g. netting or spikes) at the hotel to eliminate the roosting area. • Mitigation of the health, safety, and property risks affecting residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85-89, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Footpath blocked by tree, 24th June
item.description:
This large tree bough has been hanging on the ground for weeks, already reported sevetal tomes but no action taken. It is incredibly dangerous as it blocks the footpath completely making it very hazardous for anyone with a visual impairment to navigate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wayside Grove, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead tree outside 3 Hampden Avenue, 24th June
item.description:
The tree outside 3 Hampden Avenue is dead and has been for a while. Branches have fallen off recently and it's only a matter of time before more falls off causing damage to parked cars and the wall. The tree did not bloom this year nor the past few years. Can the tree please be inspected and if required removed and a new tree planted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampden Avenue, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
